Comment: Team Match against the same player I just annotated "The Fight is On" against. This time I'm white and go with the open game.

Alekhine's defense. Alekhine is my favorite world champion. I've always liked reading about the guy. But I don't like his defense. It seems a bit weak, compared to other black choices. Too bad he didn't invent the Sicilian...

I think 8. Nc3 is the prescribed move, but I am a little concerned about black playing Bxf3. White must either recapture with the g2 pawn, destroying the castle, or with the bishop on e2, forfeiting defense of the c4 pawn and losing it. However, at least for now, after 7. ... Bxf3 8. Bxf3 Nxc4? white has 9. Bxb7 winning back the pawn and about to win the exchange. White must be alert and watch out for black defending against this continuation.

Like that right there. Black defended against the continuation so now black can do damage with Bxf3. So first, white makes an attack that black must deal with first.

The pawn on b2 seems en prise, but the white bishop on d4 is defending it now that white's knight moved to e4. If 16. ... Nxb2?, black immediately puts white's queen en prise, and white cannot just play 17. Bxb2? for then black plays 17. ... Bxb2 and gains a pawn. Instead, white plays a zwischenzug with 17. Nxf6+! gxf6 18. Bxb2 and white has gained a bishop for a pawn.

The pawn on b2 seems en prise, but the white bishop on d4 is defending it now that white's knight moved to e4. If 16. ... Nxb2?, black immediately puts white's queen en prise, and white cannot just play 17. Bxb2? for then black plays 17. ... Bxb2 and gains a pawn. Instead, white plays a zwischenzug with 17. Nxf6+! gxf6 18. Bxb2 and white has gained a bishop for a pawn.
And now the queen takes up the defense of b2, and adds pressure against the knight on c4 which now must be protected further, or moved.
